DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Isodose Amount Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Percentage value to represent a radiation dose of equal intensity applied to more than one body area; of or relating to points or zones in a medium that receive equal doses of radiation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A radiation dose of equal intensity applied to more than one body area; of or relating to points or zones in a medium that receive equal doses of radiation._The total quantity or number.

Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A radiation dose of equal intensity applied to more than one body area; of or relating to points or zones in a medium that receive equal doses of radiation.

Property.changeDescription: Change context to caBIG to avoid duplication.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed that is a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/23/18 jk chg reg status to Standard as part of RECIST FG content; reused by 30 CDEs and multiple SOs. 10-19-2018 TMT received permission from BC to transfer ownership from NIDCR to NCI Standards.
